Williams was a professor emeritus of biology at the State University of New
York at Stony Brook. He was best known for his vigorous critique of group
selection. The work of Williams in this area, along with W. D. Hamilton, John
Maynard Smith and others led to the development of a gene-centric view of
evolution in the 1960s.
